intro: Fumaria officinalis var. ragusina, commonly known as Ragusina yellowroot, is a variant of the greater celandine plant. It is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and parts of the Mediterranean region. The plant features a thick, rhizomatous root system that is often harvested for its medicinal properties. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters. The plant contains various alkaloids and is traditionally used in herbal medicine for its anti-inflammatory and detoxifying effects.
